verses.text: It came to pass after this also, \add that\add* the children of Moab , and the children of Ammon , and with them \add other\add* beside the Ammonites , came against Jehoshaphat to battle.

Then there came some that told Jehoshaphat , saying , There cometh a great multitude against thee from beyond the sea on this side Syria ; and, behold, they \add be\add* in Hazazon-tamar , which \add is\add* En-gedi.
And Jehoshaphat feared , and set himself to seek the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and proclaimed a fast throughout all Judah.\f + \fr 20.3 \ft himself: Heb. his face\f*

And Judah gathered themselves together , to ask \add help\add* of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*: even out of all the cities of Judah they came to seek the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*. \p
¶ And Jehoshaphat stood in the congregation of Judah and Jerusalem , in the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, before the new court ,

And said , O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God of our fathers , \add art\add* not thou God in heaven ? and rulest \add not\add* thou over all the kingdoms of the heathen ? and in thine hand \add is there not\add* power and might , so that none is able to withstand thee?

\add Art\add* not thou our God , \add who\add* didst drive out the inhabitants of this land before thy people Israel , and gavest it to the seed of Abraham thy friend for ever ?\f + \fr 20.7 \ft who: Heb. thou\f*
And they dwelt therein, and have built thee a sanctuary therein for thy name , saying ,

If, \add when\add* evil cometh upon us, \add as\add* the sword , judgment , or pestilence , or famine , we stand before this house , and in thy presence , (for thy name \add is\add* in this house ,) and cry unto thee in our affliction , then thou wilt hear and help.

And now, behold, the children of Ammon and Moab and mount Seir , whom thou wouldest not let Israel invade , when they came out of the land of Egypt , but they turned from them, and destroyed them not;
Behold, \add I say, how\add* they reward us, to come to cast us out of thy possession , which thou hast given us to inherit.
O our God , wilt thou not judge them? for we have no might against this great company that cometh against us; neither know we what to do : but our eyes \add are\add* upon thee.
And all Judah stood before the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, with their little ones , their wives , and their children. \p

¶ Then upon Jahaziel the son of Zechariah , the son of Benaiah , the son of Jeiel , the son of Mattaniah , a Levite of the sons of Asaph , came the Spirit of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* in the midst of the congregation ;

And he said , Hearken ye, all Judah , and ye inhabitants of Jerusalem , and thou king Jehoshaphat , Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* unto you, Be not afraid nor dismayed by reason of this great multitude ; for the battle \add is\add* not yours, but God’s.

To morrow go ye down against them: behold, they come up by the cliff of Ziz ; and ye shall find them at the end of the brook , before the wilderness of Jeruel.\f + \fr 20.16 \ft cliff: Heb. ascent\f*\f + \fr 20.16 \ft brook: or, valley\f*

Ye shall not \add need\add* to fight in this \add battle:\add* set yourselves, stand ye \add still\add*, and see the salvation of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* with you, O Judah and Jerusalem : fear not, nor be dismayed ; to morrow go out against them: for the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* \add will be\add* with you.

And Jehoshaphat bowed his head with \add his\add* face to the ground : and all Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem fell before the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, worshipping the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.
And the Levites , of the children of the Kohathites , and of the children of the Korhites , stood up to praise the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God of Israel with a loud voice on high. \p

¶ And they rose early in the morning , and went forth into the wilderness of Tekoa : and as they went forth , Jehoshaphat stood and said , Hear me, O Judah , and ye inhabitants of Jerusalem ; Believe in the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* your God , so shall ye be established ; believe his prophets , so shall ye prosper.

And when he had consulted with the people , he appointed singers unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and that should praise the beauty of holiness , as they went out before the army , and to say , Praise the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*; for his mercy \add endureth\add* for ever.  +  r 20.21  t that…: Heb. praisers * \p

¶ And when they began to sing and to praise , the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* set ambushments against the children of Ammon , Moab , and mount Seir , which were come against Judah ; and they were smitten.\f + \fr 20.22 \ft And when…: Heb. And in the time that they, etc\f*\f + \fr 20.22 \ft to sing…: Heb. in singing and praise\f*\f + \fr 20.22 \ft they were…: or, they smote one another\f*

For the children of Ammon and Moab stood up against the inhabitants of mount Seir , utterly to slay and destroy \add them:\add* and when they had made an end of the inhabitants of Seir , every one helped to destroy another.\f + \fr 20.23 \ft to destroy: Heb. for the destruction\f*

And when Judah came toward the watch tower in the wilderness , they looked unto the multitude , and, behold, they \add were\add* dead bodies fallen to the earth , and none escaped.\f + \fr 20.24 \ft none…: Heb. there was not an escaping\f*

And when Jehoshaphat and his people came to take away the spoil of them, they found among them in abundance both riches with the dead bodies , and precious jewels , which they stripped off for themselves, more than they could carry away : and they were three days in gathering of the spoil , it was so much. \p

¶ And on the fourth day they assembled themselves in the valley of Berachah ; for there they blessed the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: therefore the name of the same place was called , The valley of Berachah , unto this day.\f + \fr 20.26 \ft Berachah: that is, blessing\f*

Then they returned , every man of Judah and Jerusalem , and Jehoshaphat in the forefront of them, to go again to Jerusalem with joy ; for the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* had made them to rejoice over their enemies.\f + \fr 20.27 \ft forefront: Heb. head\f*
And they came to Jerusalem with psalteries and harps and trumpets unto the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
And the fear of God was on all the kingdoms of \add those\add* countries , when they had heard that the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* fought against the enemies of Israel.
So the realm of Jehoshaphat was quiet : for his God gave him rest round about. \p

¶ And Jehoshaphat reigned over Judah : \add he was\add* thirty and five years old when he began to reign , and he reigned twenty and five years in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name \add was\add* Azubah the daughter of Shilhi.
And he walked in the way of Asa his father , and departed not from it, doing \add that which was\add* right in the sight of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
Howbeit the high places were not taken away : for as yet the people had not prepared their hearts unto the God of their fathers.

Now the rest of the acts of Jehoshaphat , first and last , behold, they \add are\add* written in the book of Jehu the son of Hanani , who \add is\add* mentioned in the book of the kings of Israel.\f + \fr 20.34 \ft book of Jehu: Heb. words, etc\f*\f + \fr 20.34 \ft is mentioned: Heb. was made to ascend\f* \p
¶ And after this did Jehoshaphat king of Judah join himself with Ahaziah king of Israel , who did very wickedly :
And he joined himself with him to make ships to go to Tarshish : and they made the ships in Ezion-geber.

Then Eliezer the son of Dodavah of Mareshah prophesied against Jehoshaphat , saying , Because thou hast joined thyself with Ahaziah , the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath broken thy works. And the ships were broken , that they were not able to go to Tarshish.
